alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 7:35PM CST until March 04 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-041345- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.Y.0003.000000T0000Z-230304T1800Z/ /CANO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 735 PM CST Fri Mar 3 2023 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The creek remains mostly within its banks in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. Some high stages on small feeder streams result in very localized... short-term overflows of mainstem bottomlands. Low-lying fields are briefly cut off from easy access. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to fall. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
